page.title: 04NEW ABBEY - EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Employment in this area is made up mainly of the industries of Farming, Forestry and Tourism. The nine farms are predominantly dairy-based and they each employ, on average, two persons. There is also a large Grain Merchant's and Animal Food Manufacturer's business at Lochhill which serves the farming community and employs a number of people. Forestry is centred on the two wooded areas at Shambellie and on the lower slopes of Criffel.There is a large sawmill in New Abbey, employing nearly fifty people, where most of the wood is sent for treatment. Tourism is evident in the village of New Abbey with the ancient Sweetheart Abbey,the Corn Mill and the Costume Museum at Shambellie House. Serving the tourists,and the local people, are a shop,two hotels and a tea room.
